intro: Scleria striatonux, commonly known as the narrow-striated sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soils. Scleria striatonux is often found in temperate regions, particularly in areas with high humidity. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
